comments: The sequence is well defined, since frac(n*e)>0 for n>0.Let b(n,m) = |{a(k)| 1<=k<=n, a(k)>=m}| be the number of the first n terms which are >= m >= 1.Then, lim b(n,m)/n = 1/m for n-->oo since frac(n*e) is uniformly distributed. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Apr 15 2012
links: Clark Kimberling, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: f[n_] := Floor[1/FractionalPart[n*E]]; Array[f, 100] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 17 2012 *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_
